articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel prepared on Saturday to receive six more hostages from Gaza in exchange for hundreds of Palestinian prisoners and detainees, after accusations over the return of a misidentified body this week threatened to derail a fragile truce.
articles.title: Israel prepares to receive six more Gaza hostages

articles.author: Steve Holland, Nandita Bose
articles.description: White House national security adviser Mike Waltz said on Friday he expects Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to sign a minerals agreement with the United States as part of efforts to end the Ukraine war, while President Donald Trump said Kyiv has no cards to play with.
articles.title: White House expects Ukraine to sign critical minerals deal soon

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Joey Roulette
articles.description: Ukraine's access to SpaceX-owned Starlink was brought up in talks between U.S. and Ukrainian officials after Ukrainian President Zelenskiy turned down an initial proposal from U.S. Treasury Secretary Bessent.
articles.title: Exclusive: US could cut Ukraine's access to Starlink internet services over minerals, say sources

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said he met Polish Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski in Washington on Friday and discussed "fair and reciprocal market access" and the "need for NATO Allies to increase defense investment without delay".
articles.title: Rubio says he discussed with Poland the 'need' for NATO allies to raise spending

articles.author: Andrew Chung, John Kruzel
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court declined on Friday to let Donald Trump immediately fire the head of a federal watchdog agency after a judge's order had temporarily blocked the Republican president from ousting the official.
articles.title: US Supreme Court declines to let Trump immediately fire watchdog agency head

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States on Friday proposed a draft United Nations resolution to mark the third anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, a move that pits Washington against an effort by Kyiv and European allies to have their own text adopted by the General Assembly.
articles.title: US proposes rival UN action on Ukraine, pitting it against Europe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia accused China on Saturday of failing to give satisfactory reasons for what it called inadequate notice of a live-fire drill in waters between Australia and New Zealand that forced airlines to divert flights.
articles.title: Australia says China failed to explain inadequate navy live-fire notice

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Kenyan President William Ruto urged an immediate ceasefire in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo during a phone call, the State Department said on Friday.
articles.title: US top diplomat Rubio, Kenyan president call for ceasefire in eastern Congo

articles.author: Thomas Escritt
articles.description: German police arrested a suspect in the stabbing on Friday evening at Berlin's Holocaust memorial that seriously injured a man two days before a watershed national election.
articles.title: Berlin police arrest suspect in stabbing at Holocaust memorial

articles.author: Aleksandra Michalska, Jonathan Allen
articles.description: Hadi Matar was found guilty on Friday of attempting to murder the novelist Salman Rushdie in an onstage stabbing attack at a New York arts institute in 2022.
articles.title: Hadi Matar guilty of attempted murder of novelist Salman Rushdie
